subject: p15259244
History: Mitral valve repair and CABG, evaluate for effusions.
Impression: PA and lateral chest compared to through : Small bilateral pleural effusions, including a fissural component in the right major fissure, have increased slightly since. There is no pulmonary edema and no pneumothorax. Moderate-to-severe enlargement of the cardiac silhouette is chronic and unchanged. There is no appreciable pulmonary vascular engorgement. A dual-channel right supraclavicular dialysis set ends in the right atrium, and left PICC line ends low in the SVC.
